description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the Windows kernel-mode driver elevation of privilege vulnerability described in CVE-2024-21309:

1. Ensure your system is updated to the latest Windows build that addresses this CVE.
2. Apply the relevant KB update packages listed below to your system:
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2: [KB5034123](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034123)
   - For Windows 11 Version 22H2: [KB5034123](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034123)
   - For Windows 11 Version 21H2: [KB5034121](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034121)
   - For Windows 10 (32-bit): [KB5034129](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034129)

**Details**:
- This vulnerability allows an attacker with local access to elevate privileges and potentially gain unauthorized control of the system.
- Ensure that all user accounts are informed about security practices to prevent social engineering attacks that may lead to exploitation of this vulnerability.

**Preconditions**:
- Verify that existing build numbers match the specified ones to ensure compatibility with the provided patches.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with any updates.
